list_definition.definition: to give new strength and energy to; to make (a person etc) feel less hot, tired etc, eg after or during a period of hard work

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: This glass of cool lemonade will refresh you.

list_ex_of_english: One need not always agree with the claims the text makes to find the effort valuable, refreshing and suggestive.

By investigating the users of a senior centre's inter-personal experiences, it has been shown that the meanings they attach to their participation are diverse and continuously developed, contested and refreshed.
Words with a short articulation duration occupy less temporal capacity within the phonological store and are thus subvocally refreshed at a faster rate than words with a long articulation duration.
During culture, the medium was partially refreshed every 2 days.
The analysis is plainly interdisciplinary and the results can be refreshing.
If earlier my heart needed to breathe and be refreshed, it needs that even more now with the sudden arrival of so many spirits, which are warm by nature.
A partially flowthrough system was used refreshing about 6 l per hour.
The attempt to bring in international experiences is commendable and, viewed in the best possible light brings diverse and refreshing contrasts into a debate that is too often regionalised.
